meanings.sent1: She resells her old clothes online to make extra money.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore resells used textbooks to students at a discounted price.
meanings.sent3: He resells his video games to buy new ones.
meanings.sent4: The antique dealer resells rare items to collectors around the world.
meanings.sent5: The farmer resells his produce at the local market every week.

meanings.definition: To sell (something) back to the original seller.
meanings.sent1: After realizing the mistake, she resells the faulty product to the store.
meanings.sent2: The customer resells the unwanted gift back to the shop for store credit.
meanings.sent3: He resells the defective item to the manufacturer for a refund.
meanings.sent4: The company resells returned merchandise to their suppliers.
meanings.sent5: The seller resells the damaged goods back to the distributor.

meanings.definition: To sell (something) at a higher price than the original purchase price.
meanings.sent1: The scalper resells concert tickets for double the original price.
meanings.sent2: The designer resells vintage clothing at a premium to fashion enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: He resells limited edition sneakers for a profit.
meanings.sent4: The art dealer resells paintings by famous artists for a significant markup.
meanings.sent5: The collector resells rare coins at auctions for a handsome sum.
